            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Central Saanich Water Quality project aims to build community partnerships, and develop and implement sampling protocols for long term, community-based monitoring of the KENNES (Hagan-Graham) and Tetayut Watersheds. Water quality data is collected through portable water quality sensors and grab samples sent for laboratory analysis. This information is analyzed with historical data to determine water quality status and trends in the watershed. Water quality monitoring has been conducted in KENNES watershed since 2005, and since 2011 in Tetayut Watershed.</gco:CharacterString>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-1w3h-7o68
notes: The Central Saanich Water Quality project aims to build community partnerships, and develop and implement sampling protocols for long term, community-based monitoring of the KENNES (Hagan-Graham) and Tetayut Watersheds. Water quality data is collected through portable water quality sensors and grab samples sent for laboratory analysis. This information is analyzed with historical data to determine water quality status and trends in the watershed. Water quality monitoring has been conducted in KENNES watershed since 2005, and since 2011 in Tetayut Watershed.

notes_translated.en: The Central Saanich Water Quality project aims to build community partnerships, and develop and implement sampling protocols for long term, community-based monitoring of the KENNES (Hagan-Graham) and Tetayut Watersheds. Water quality data is collected through portable water quality sensors and grab samples sent for laboratory analysis. This information is analyzed with historical data to determine water quality status and trends in the watershed. Water quality monitoring has been conducted in KENNES watershed since 2005, and since 2011 in Tetayut Watershed.
notes_translated.fr: Le projet Central Saanich Water Quality vise à établir des partenariats communautaires et à développer et mettre en œuvre des protocoles d'échantillonnage pour une surveillance communautaire à long terme des bassins versants de KENNES (Hagan-Graham) et de Tetayut. Les données sur la qualité de l'eau sont recueillies au moyen de capteurs portatifs de qualité de l'eau et d'échantillons choisis envoyés pour analyse en laboratoire. Ces informations sont analysées à l'aide de données historiques afin de déterminer l'état de la qualité de l'eau et les tendances dans le bassin versant. La surveillance de la qualité de l'eau est effectuée dans le bassin versant de KENNES depuis 2005 et depuis 2011 dans le bassin versant de Tetayut.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Peninsula Streams Society Central Saanich Water Quality Monitoring

title_translated.en: Peninsula Streams Society Central Saanich Water Quality Monitoring
title_translated.fr: Surveillance de la qualité de l'eau de la Peninsula Streams Society à Central Saanich
